title: Top Ethereum ERC20 Tokens Guide & List - finder.com.au
content:
A token is a type of cryptocurrency that can be created by anyone, without the need for much technical know-how or skill.

This is one of the reasons there are so many cryptocurrencies on the market - tokens have enabled almost any brand, company or idea to make their own in a matter of minutes.

ERC20 is a technical standard for tokens issued on the Ethereum blockchain.

In this guide we explain how they work, list some popular ones and show you where to store them.

Disclaimer: This information should not be interpreted as an endorsement of cryptocurrency or any specific provider, service or offering. It is not a recommendation to trade.

What are ERC20 tokens?

Since its launch in 2015, Ethereum has become one of the driving forces behind the growth of cryptocurrency. Initial coin offerings (ICOs) have raised billions of dollars in funding for crypto projects from all around the world, and most of these ICOs are based on the Ethereum platform. Buyers contribute Ether (ETH) or bitcoin (BTC) to participate in a crowdfunding sale, and in return receive some of the ICO project’s native tokens.

ERC20 is a technical standard for tokens issued on the Ethereum blockchain, providing a list of rules that all Ethereum-based tokens must follow. These include how the tokens can be transferred, how transactions are approved, how users can access data about a token and the total supply of tokens. The protocol is necessary to ensure compatibility between the many different tokens issued on Ethereum.

Just like bitcoin, Litecoin and any other cryptocurrency, ERC20 tokens are blockchain-based assets that have value and can be sent and received. The difference is that instead of running on their own blockchain, these tokens are issued on the Ethereum network. This means they’re hosted by Ethereum addresses and are sent using Ethereum transactions.

ERC20 tokens are "smart assets" that can be programmed to do certain things by using smart contracts. For instance, tokens can be programmed to be paid out to employees by the hour or minute instead of at the end of the work week. This sort of programmability allows for new sorts of financial applications and innovations and is part of what makes Ethereum special.

Hackday project In 2018 as part of a hackathon I created a cryptocurrency in about 20 minutes by using the ERC20 token standard. It cost me about AUD $30 of ETH at the time. The goal was to use the tokens as reward points that would automatically be paid out to anyone who used green financial products. Doing so helped me bring my prototype to life by having a working cryptocurrency that I was able to send to judges and other participants. — James Edwards, Cryptocurrency Expert



Popular ERC20 tokens list

Many crypto newcomers are surprised to discover just how prevalent ERC20 tokens are. Take a look at a list of the top 100 digital currencies by market cap, and you'll see plenty of well-known currencies that use the ERC20 standard, including:

Important: Some coins are launched as an ERC20 token, before being migrated over to their own blockchain. This means that the token will have to be swapped for a coin on the new blockchain once the migration is complete. If this happens, you will need to migrate your tokens over to the new chain, and will no longer be able to send the tokens to an Ethereum-based wallet. If you send coins from one blockchain to a wallet on another blockchain, you will lose your coins. Make sure you know which blockchain your coins or tokens are hosted on before sending them to a new wallet or address, especially as some tokens may exist across multiple chains.

Find out more about altcoins in our top 100+ list.

Did you know? Want to know why they're called ERC20 tokens? The "ERC" stands for "Ethereum Request for Comments", which is an official protocol used to propose improvements to the Ethereum network. The "20" is the unique ID number used to identify the proposal.

Which wallets support ERC20 tokens?

If you’re buying any digital currency that’s issued as an ERC20 token, you’ll need to find a wallet that’s compatible with these types of tokens. Happily, because ERC20 tokens are so popular, there are plenty of wallets to choose from, including the following:

To find out ways to securely store your ERC20 tokens, you can begin by comparing the above wallets. You can also learn more about storing your cryptocurrency in our ultimate guide to wallets.

title: XRP Army Finds Clues Why Hinman Gave Ethereum Free Pass - Bitcoinist
content:
The XRP community has been digging through the recently released 400+ pages of Hinman documents in the legal battle between Ripple Labs and the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), examining why the former director of the SEC’s Division of Corporation Finance, Bill Hinamn, gave Ethereum (ETH) a free pass as a non-security.

As NewsBTC reported, Hinman spoke on the phone with Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin ahead of his speech to ascertain how Ethereum operates. In addition, Hinman defied the recommendation of the SEC’s Office of General Counsel (OGC), which opposed including ETH in the notorious speech.

New Revelations By The XRP Army

XRP community member Ashley Prosper has read the Hinman documents in full and found some interesting stuff regarding Ethereum and Bill Hinman. To recall, Hinman returned to the law firm Simpson Thacher, which is also part of the Ethereum Enterprise Alliance, in 2020.

According to Prosper, the documents reveal how Hinman was pushed hard by Simpson Thatcher and ConsenSys to give the Ethereum Free Pass speech. Hinman intentionally refrained from sending the speech to any of the commissioners except Jay Clayton because it would, in his words, “slow down the process significantly.”

In addition, Hinman stated that he researched Ethereum in depth before giving his speech. Still, he could not answer how much Ether (ETH) Joe Lubin, Vitalik Buterin or the Ethereum Foundation owned, or who was funding the Ethereum Foundation.

The XRP Community member also speculates that the SEC is so concerned about the revelation of Joseph Lubin’s name that it has blacked out any mention of the name “Joe” in Hinman’s interview. Even when it was about Joseph Grundfest. Prosper further states:

Jorge Tenreiro [SEC attorney] is fighting tooth and nail in Hinman’s deposition to prevent any answers related to ETH, Ethereum, Consensys, or Lubin. Just look at how he approaches the ETH questions compared to the Bitcoin ones.

#XRP #XRPCommunity

The SEC is so worried about revealing Joseph Lubins’ name that they redacted every reference to the name Joe in Hinmans deposition. Even when it belonged to Joesph Grundfest, whom they already identified by name. The fear is real… what does @ethereumJoseph… pic.twitter.com/j9vUnuHIOy — Ashley PROSPER (@AshleyPROSPER1) June 15, 2023

Yet Prosper found a passage in the documents that reveals Hinman had four to five meetings with ConsenSys, as well as face-to-face conversations with people associated with the company.

Renowned XRP community member Mr Huber speculates, based on Prosper’s findings, that the reason for the urgency of the speech was to exempt Ethereum from the ethics provision coming into effect the next week, which would have required all government employees to disclose their ETH holdings.

“Hinman’s speech not only prevented that from happening, it also ensured that many politicians joined Ethereum afterwards, which is why people are still trying to cover it up,” Mr Huber says.

Renowned XRP lawyer Jeremy Hogan has a similar suspicion. He claims Hinman was paid to “give ETH a free pass”. In an interview on CryptoLaw, Hogan speculated that an Ethereum member bribed Hinman to give ETH a free pass during the speech:

My speculation is that Ripple’s position here is that Bill Hinman was somehow paid, and he was paid by the Ethereum Foundation or someone related to Ethereum to give the speech, give Ethereum a free pass.

However, Hogan also clarified that Ripple does not want to make accusations against others like the Ethereum Foundation, presumably because there is not enough evidence.

At press time, XRP changed hands for $0.4735, down 6.3% in the last 24 hours.

Featured image from VOI, chart from TradingView.com

title: EigenLayer Introduced Restaking Protocol on Ethereum Mainnet - The Coin Republic
content:
EigenLayer, a Seattle-based Decentralized Finance (DeFi) platform, announced the deployment of its staking protocol on the Ethereum mainnet. Ethereum released its Shapella Upgrade on April 12, 2023, allowing un-staking of Ether. The investors who staked 32 ETH to become validators could not withdraw their money, and the upgrade allowed them to gain rewards from this staking mechanism.

We are thrilled to announce the deployment of the Stage-1 EigenLayer protocol on Ethereum Mainnet!



This marks a significant milestone in our mission to create a permissionless environment for innovation.https://t.co/QZ529WsIAS pic.twitter.com/SYHexSRTA0 — EigenLayer (@eigenlayer) June 14, 2023

Re-staking Protocol Rolled out on Ethereum Mainnet

EigenLayer would allow ETH stakers to deposit select liquid staking tokens, including Rocket Pool ETH (rETH), Lido stETH (stETH), and Coinbase Wrapped Staked ETH (cbETH). In March 2023, EigenLabs, the developers behind EigenLayer, raised $64.5 million at the valuation of $500 million in a series of investment rounds, adding another $50 Million in a Series A funding round.

The parameters set by the DeFi protocol for liquid and native staking are set along with liquid re-staking acceptance of a maximum of 3,200 for each liquid re-staking token and a maximum limit of 32 tokens per deposit address. Native re-staking is scheduled to be paused with the limitation of 9,600 ETH reached on the protocol.

The concept of liquid staking has been gaining serious ground since the blockchain shifted from energy-intensive Proof-of-Work (PoW) consensus mechanism to a Proof-of-Stake (PoS) mechanism through a merge that occurred in September 2022. Data suggests that a total of $16.92 Billion ETH are currently staked on the top five liquid staking protocols.

The Upgrade Which Allowed Un-Staking

The Ethereum Shapella Upgrade was operationalized on April 12, 2023. The soft-fork event on the blockchain allowed the un-staking of nearly 4.4 Million ETH staked after the merge. Before the upgrade, analysts argued that this step would be devastating as it would result in a withdrawal influx, which would badly affect the price.

Contrary to speculations, the upgrade proved beneficial as most stakers steered away from dissolving their stake and preferred to earn passive income through staking. Moreover, developers were rooting for this to happen, as this is believed to be the main motive behind the upgrade.

Experts predict that the scenario shall only grow from here onwards, especially when deflationary forces come into play. The average waiting time for gaining yield from staking is roughly over a month. Still, the investors are lining up for it.

Data suggests that over 50,000 individuals want to become validators on the blockchain. Also, the current annualized yield for staking ETH is between 4% to 5%. This hints that the Ether owners are eager to become validators and enjoy dual benefits.

The Beacon Chain went live in December 2020, and since then, staking emerged as a passive source of income. However, following this, the stakers could not leverage any yield from the locked coins. Furthermore, the subsequent price drop caused most stakers to bear losses.

The upgrade facilitates the flexibility of withdrawing the staked ETH, preventing the fear of the amount being locked for an extended period. This scenario caused the deposits on the blockchain to surpass the withdrawals for the first time. Additionally, the investors now have a new avenue to earn apart from holding on to ETH and waiting for the price to surge.

title: Is Ethereum a Good Investment for Beginners? - Coinposters - Cryptocurrency News
content:
Cryptocurrencies have gained significant popularity in recent years, and Ethereum, in particular, has emerged as one of the leading blockchain platforms. As a beginner investor, it’s important to carefully evaluate the potential of any investment before committing your hard-earned money. This article aims to provide a comprehensive analysis of whether Ethereum is a good investment for beginners. We will delve into the features of Ethereum, examine the factors to consider, explore the benefits and risks associated with investing in Ethereum, and offer tips to help you make an informed decision.

Overview of Ethereum

Ethereum is a decentralized blockchain platform that enables the creation and execution of smart contracts and decentralized applications (dApps). It was proposed by Vitalik Buterin in 2013 and launched in 2015. Ethereum stands out among other cryptocurrencies due to its versatility and ability to support a wide range of applications beyond digital currency.

Key Features and Advantages of Ethereum

Ethereum offers several key features that contribute to its appeal and potential as an investment:

Smart Contracts: Ethereum introduced the concept of smart contracts, which are self-executing agreements with predefined rules. These contracts automatically enforce the terms and conditions, eliminating the need for intermediaries and enhancing efficiency.

Decentralized Applications (dApps): Ethereum provides a platform for developers to build decentralized applications. These dApps operate on the blockchain, offering transparency, immutability, and resistance to censorship.

Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM): The EVM is a runtime environment that executes smart contracts on the Ethereum network. It allows developers to write code in multiple programming languages, making it accessible to a broad developer community.

Comparison with Other Cryptocurrencies

While Ethereum is often compared to Bitcoin, they serve different purposes. Bitcoin primarily functions as a digital currency, whereas Ethereum’s primary focus is on facilitating the development of decentralized applications and smart contracts. Ethereum’s programmable nature and extensive developer support give it a unique advantage over many other cryptocurrencies.

What is the minimum amount to invest in Ethereum

Factors to Consider for Beginner Investors

Before investing in Ethereum, it’s crucial to evaluate several factors that can significantly impact the investment’s success.

Market Analysis of Ethereum

To assess the investment potential of Ethereum, consider the following:

Historical Performance and Price Trends: Analyze the historical price data of Ethereum and its market performance. Look for patterns, trends, and potential catalysts that have influenced its price movements in the past.

Market Capitalization and Liquidity: Market capitalization represents the total value of all Ethereum in circulation. Higher market capitalization indicates a more established and liquid market, which can contribute to price stability and ease of trading.

Risk Assessment

Understanding the risks associated with investing in Ethereum is essential. Consider the following:

Volatility and Price Fluctuations: Cryptocurrencies, including Ethereum, are known for their price volatility. The value of Ethereum can fluctuate significantly in a short period, which may lead to substantial gains or losses.

Regulatory and Legal Considerations: The regulatory landscape surrounding cryptocurrencies is evolving. Changes in regulations or government interventions can impact the value and adoption of Ethereum.

Security Risks and Potential Vulnerabilities: Like any digital asset, Ethereum is susceptible to security risks such as hacking, phishing attacks, and smart contract vulnerabilities. Assess the security measures and best practices implemented by the Ethereum community to mitigate these risks.

Benefits of Investing in Ethereum

Now let’s explore the potential benefits of investing in Ethereum:

Potential for Long-Term Growth: Ethereum has demonstrated remarkable growth since its inception. Its widespread adoption and the increasing number of decentralized applications being built on the platform indicate its potential for long-term growth.

Adoption and Use Cases of Ethereum: Ethereum’s versatility has led to its adoption across various industries. It has found applications in finance, supply chain management, decentralized finance (DeFi), non-fungible tokens (NFTs), and more. The growing use cases contribute to the demand for Ethereum and its potential as an investment.

Development of Decentralized Applications (dApps): The Ethereum platform has fostered a vibrant ecosystem of developers and entrepreneurs. The continuous development and innovation in dApps enhance the value proposition of Ethereum.

Diversification of Investment Portfolio

Investing in Ethereum can provide diversification benefits for your investment portfolio:

Correlation with Other Assets: Ethereum’s price movements often exhibit a low correlation with traditional assets such as stocks and bonds. Adding Ethereum to a diversified portfolio can potentially reduce overall portfolio risk.

Hedge Against Traditional Financial Systems: Ethereum’s decentralized nature makes it less reliant on traditional financial systems. It can serve as a hedge against inflation, economic uncertainties, and geopolitical risks.

WATCH THE VIDEO BELOW

Is Ethereum a Good Investment for Beginners?

Community and Developer Support

Ethereum’s active and engaged community, as well as its extensive developer support, are notable advantages:

Ethereum’s Active Ecosystem: Ethereum has a vibrant and passionate community that actively contributes to its development and growth. The community’s support helps in addressing challenges, fostering innovation, and driving adoption.

Ongoing Upgrades and Improvements: Ethereum is undergoing significant upgrades, such as the transition from a Proof-of-Work (PoW) to a Proof-of-Stake (PoS) consensus mechanism. These upgrades aim to improve scalability, energy efficiency, and overall network performance, making Ethereum an attractive long-term investment.

Risks and Challenges

It’s important to be aware of the risks and challenges associated with investing in Ethereum:

Technical Challenges: Ethereum faces scalability and transaction speed issues, especially during periods of high network congestion. These challenges need to be addressed to support widespread adoption and maintain user experience.

Energy Consumption and Environmental Concerns: Ethereum, like many other cryptocurrencies, currently operates on a PoW consensus mechanism, which requires substantial energy consumption. As the world focuses on sustainable practices, the environmental impact of PoW-based cryptocurrencies may pose challenges in the long run.

Competition from Other Blockchain Platforms: Ethereum faces competition from other blockchain platforms that offer similar functionalities and seek to address its scalability issues. Emerging technologies and protocols may pose challenges to Ethereum’s dominance.

Regulatory Risks and Government Interventions

Regulatory developments and government interventions can significantly impact the value and adoption of Ethereum:

Impact of Regulations on the Cryptocurrency Market: Governments around the world are formulating regulations for cryptocurrencies. The regulatory landscape can influence investor sentiment, market liquidity, and the overall growth of Ethereum.

Tips for Beginner Investors

If you decide to invest in Ethereum as a beginner, consider the following tips:

Educate Yourself About Ethereum and Blockchain Technology:

Gain a solid understanding of how Ethereum works, its use cases, and the underlying technology. This knowledge will help you make informed investment decisions.

Set Clear Investment Goals and Risk Tolerance:

Define your investment goals, whether they are short-term or long-term, and assess your risk tolerance. Cryptocurrency investments can be highly volatile, so it’s important to invest only what you can afford to lose.

Consider Dollar-Cost Averaging and Long-Term Holding Strategies:

Instead of investing a lump sum, consider investing a fixed amount at regular intervals (dollar-cost averaging). This strategy helps mitigate the impact of short-term price fluctuations. Additionally, consider holding your investment for the long term to potentially benefit from Ethereum’s growth over time.

Utilize Reputable Exchanges and Wallets:

Choose reputable cryptocurrency exchanges and wallets to ensure the security of your investments. Research and compare different platforms to find the ones that prioritize security measures and offer user-friendly interfaces.

Keep track of the latest developments in the Ethereum ecosystem, regulatory changes, technological advancements, and market trends. Stay updated through reliable sources, such as reputable news outlets, official Ethereum communication channels, and trusted cryptocurrency forums. This information will help you make informed decisions based on current market conditions.

Practice Risk Management:

Diversify your investment portfolio across different asset classes, including cryptocurrencies, to mitigate risk. Avoid investing all your funds into a single asset, such as Ethereum. Set stop-loss orders or establish exit strategies to protect your investment from significant price declines.

Seek Professional Advice:

If you’re unsure about investing in Ethereum or need guidance, consider seeking advice from financial professionals who have experience and knowledge in cryptocurrencies. They can provide personalized advice based on your financial goals, risk tolerance, and investment horizon.

Summary

Investing in Ethereum can offer potential opportunities for beginner investors, but it’s essential to conduct thorough research and understand the risks involved. Ethereum’s innovative features, widespread adoption, and strong developer community contribute to its long-term growth potential. However, it’s crucial to consider factors such as price volatility, regulatory risks, technical challenges, and competition from other blockchain platforms.

By evaluating these factors, setting clear investment goals, staying informed about market trends, and practicing risk management, beginners can make informed decisions regarding Ethereum investments. Remember, investing in cryptocurrencies involves risks, and it’s important to invest only what you can afford to lose. As the cryptocurrency market continues to evolve, staying informed and adapting to changing conditions will be key to successful investment outcomes.

title: Simplest Way to Buy Ethereum: A Comprehensive Guide for Beginners - Coinposters - Cryptocurrency News
content:
Cryptocurrencies have gained significant popularity in recent years, and Ethereum, with its vast potential and smart contract capabilities, has emerged as one of the leading players in the market. If you’re new to the world of cryptocurrencies and wondering how to buy Ethereum, this comprehensive guide will walk you through the simplest way to get started. From research and planning to selecting a platform, creating an account, funding your account, and securing your investment, we’ll explain each step in detail on the Simplest Way to Buy Ethereum, ensuring you have a solid understanding of the process.

Research and Planning

Before diving into buying Ethereum, it’s crucial to familiarize yourself with the cryptocurrency and its underlying technology. Ethereum is a decentralized platform that enables developers to build and deploy smart contracts and decentralized applications (DApps). By understanding the potential benefits and use cases of Ethereum, you can make an informed investment decision.

Once you’re familiar with Ethereum, it’s time to research available platforms and exchanges. Consider factors such as user experience, fees, security measures, and supported payment methods. Look for reputable platforms that have a user-friendly interface and positive reviews from the community. By conducting thorough research, you can choose a platform that suits your needs and preferences.

In addition to selecting a platform, you’ll also need to set up a digital wallet to securely store your Ethereum. A digital wallet is a software application that allows you to store, send, and receive cryptocurrencies. There are various types of wallets available, including hardware wallets, software wallets, and online wallets. Evaluate the different wallet options based on their security features, ease of use, and compatibility with Ethereum.

Remember to conduct thorough research, choose a reputable platform, secure your digital wallet, and stay informed about market trends to make informed investment decisions.

Selecting a Suitable Platform

Choosing the right platform is crucial for a seamless Ethereum buying experience. Consider the following criteria when selecting a platform:

Ease of use and user interface:

Look for a platform that offers a user-friendly interface and intuitive navigation. A clean and well-designed interface makes it easier for beginners to navigate through the buying process.

Supported payment methods:

Ensure that the platform supports your preferred payment method, whether it’s credit/debit cards, bank transfers, or other options. Different platforms may have different payment options, so choose one that aligns with your needs.

Security measures:

Prioritize platforms that have robust security measures in place, such as two-factor authentication (2FA), encryption, and cold storage for funds. A secure platform reduces the risk of unauthorized access and ensures the safety of your investment.

Reputation and user reviews:

Check online reviews and forums to gauge the platform’s reputation. Look for platforms that have positive reviews and a strong track record in the cryptocurrency community.

Evaluate different platforms based on these criteria and compare their pros and cons. Take your time to choose a platform that meets your requirements and aligns with your priorities.

Creating an Account and Verification

Once you’ve selected a suitable platform, you’ll need to create an account. The sign-up process typically involves providing your email address, creating a strong password, and agreeing to the platform’s terms of service. Some platforms may also require additional personal information for Know Your Customer (KYC) verification purposes.

During the verification process, you may be asked to provide identification documents such as a passport, driver’s license, or utility bills. Follow the platform’s instructions carefully and ensure that the documents are valid and up to date. Verification is a standard procedure that helps prevent fraud and ensures compliance with regulatory requirements.

Funding Your Account

After successfully creating and verifying your account, it’s time to fund it. Determine the payment method that suits your needs and consider factors such as fees and processing times. Common payment methods include credit/debit cards, bank transfers, and sometimes even alternative payment options like PayPal or cryptocurrency exchanges.

Choose a payment method:

Evaluate the available payment options on the platform and select the one that is most convenient for you. Credit/debit cards offer quick transactions, while bank transfers may have lower fees but longer processing times. Consider your priorities and select the method that aligns with your preferences.

Link your payment method to your account:

Follow the platform’s instructions to link your chosen payment method to your account. This usually involves providing the necessary details, such as card information or bank account details. Some platforms may require an additional verification step to ensure the ownership of the payment method.

Complete necessary verification steps:

Depending on the platform and your location, you may need to complete additional verification steps for the payment method. This could involve providing additional documentation or confirming small deposit amounts from your bank account. Follow the platform’s instructions carefully to successfully link and verify your payment method.

Placing an Order

With your account funded, you are now ready to place an order to buy Ethereum. Follow these steps to complete the purchase:

Determine the amount of Ethereum to purchase:

Consider your investment goals and budget to decide the amount of Ethereum you want to buy. It’s important to invest an amount that you are comfortable with and aligns with your risk tolerance.

Select the desired purchase option:

Platforms typically offer two main purchase options – market orders and limit orders.

Market order:

A market order allows you to buy Ethereum at the current market price. This option provides immediate execution but may result in slightly higher fees due to market fluctuations.

Limit order:

With a limit order, you can set a specific price at which you want to buy Ethereum. The order will only execute if the market reaches or goes below your specified price. This option gives you more control over the purchase price but may take longer to execute.

Complete the purchase:

Enter the amount of Ethereum you wish to buy and review the transaction details, including any applicable fees. Take a moment to double-check the details and ensure everything is accurate. Once you are satisfied, execute the order. The platform will process your order, and you will soon become a proud owner of Ethereum.

Storing and Securing Your Ethereum

After purchasing Ethereum, it’s crucial to transfer it to a secure digital wallet. Follow these steps to store and secure your Ethereum:

Obtain your wallet’s receiving address:

Set up a digital wallet if you haven’t already and obtain the wallet’s receiving address. This address is a unique identifier where you can receive Ethereum.

Initiate a withdrawal from the platform:

On the platform, look for the option to withdraw or send Ethereum. Enter your wallet’s receiving address and the amount of Ethereum you want to transfer. Review the transaction details and confirm the withdrawal.

Enable additional security measures:

Strengthen the security of your digital wallet by enabling two-factor authentication (2FA) if available. This adds an extra layer of protection by requiring a second verification step, such as a code generated on your mobile device, during login or transaction confirmation.

Back up your wallet’s private key or recovery phrase:

Digital wallets often provide a private key or recovery phrase that serves as a backup to restore access to your wallet. Safely store this information offline in multiple secure locations. Losing access to your private key or recovery phrase can result in permanent loss of your Ethereum.

By transferring your Ethereum to a digital wallet and implementing additional security measures, you have more control and ownership over your investment.

What is the simplest way to buy Ethereum?

Monitoring and Managing Your Investment

As an Ethereum investor, it’s important to stay informed and actively manage your investment. Consider the following strategies:

Keep track of Ethereum’s performance:

Utilize portfolio tracking tools and cryptocurrency market websites to monitor the performance of Ethereum. These tools provide real-time price updates, historical charts, and other relevant data to help you track the value of your investment.

Stay informed about market trends and news:

Stay updated on the latest developments in the cryptocurrency industry, Ethereum’s ecosystem, and regulatory changes. Follow reputable news sources, join online communities, and engage in discussions to gain insights into market trends and potential factors that may impact Ethereum’s price.

Consider long-term strategies and diversification:

Ethereum’s value can fluctuate over time, so it’s essential to consider long-term investment strategies. Evaluate your investment goals and risk tolerance to determine if holding Ethereum for the long term aligns with your objectives. Additionally, consider diversifying your investment portfolio by exploring other cryptocurrencies or investment opportunities to spread risk and potentially capitalize on other emerging trends.

Summary

Buying Ethereum can be a straightforward process if you approach it with the right knowledge and preparation. This comprehensive guide has walked you through the steps of buying Ethereum, from research and planning to selecting a platform, creating an account, funding it, and securing your investment. Remember to conduct thorough research, choose a reputable platform, secure your digital wallet, and stay informed about market trends to make informed investment decisions.

As the cryptocurrency market continues to evolve, it’s important to adapt and learn continuously. Stay updated with new developments, regulatory changes, and best practices to enhance your understanding and maximize the potential of your Ethereum investment. With proper research, diligence, and a strategic approach, you can navigate the process of buying Ethereum and embark on your journey into the world of cryptocurrencies.

title: EigenLayer Stage 1 positioned on Ethereum mainnet - CryptoNewsZ
content:
EigenLayer Stage 1 has been positioned on the Ethereum mainnet, through which Ethereum stakers can take part in EigenLayer, control their liquid staking tokens, and shift their funds. This is made possible with the help of EigenLayer contracts. Another option is building an EigenPod and shifting the funds to the EigenPod addresses.

In the next stage, Eigenlayer will be bringing in operators who will carry out the confirmation activities related to Actively Validated Services (AVSs) that have been duly created on the EigenLayer protocol. The third stage will witness the protocol setting off the deliverance of various AVSs by utilizing the strong EigenLayer base.

Following the delivery of restakers, operators, and AVSs on EigenLayer, the ecosystem will provide the option for stakers to allocate their staked ETH to operators. The control will remain with the stakeholder, and they will be able to select the AVSs of their choice. Operators and AVSs need to work in tandem.

Initially, the EigenLayer will have some limitations for reasons of safety. Thereafter, the restrictions will slowly be lifted until they reach an absolute no-limit situation, all for the benefit of ether holders. At this point, the protocol will be fully backing liquid staking with regards to Lido stETH (stETH), as well as Rocket Pool ETH (rETH) and Coinbase Wrapped Staked ETH (cbETH).

As for the staking limits, deposits will be accepted for 3,200 tokens against every backed asset. In the case of a user transaction, 32 tokens will be allowed. There will also be no further building of EigenPods the minute the conventional restaking reaches roughly 9,600 ETH. There will be the introduction of a seven-day withdrawal period for safety reasons.

In order to ensure further safety, EigenLayer has gone through several external safety audits, along with $2,000,000 bug bounties accessible through Immunefi. EigenLayer has the vision of decentralizing the protocol and bringing together the attached community to participate in a complete trustless staking protocol.

Smart contracts that are scalable and have the ability to pause operations were used to construct EigenLayer. Three prime governance multisigs have been assigned oversight over issues relating to contract scaling and the pause feature. There is the community multisig, the operations multisig, and the pauser multisig. All things considered, the launch of EigenLayer on Ethereum marks a significant milestone and moves open innovation into a more favorable environment.

title: Argent Wallet Review: Is This The Best Ethereum Wallet In 2023? - Blockzeit
content:
Argent Wallet is one of the latest trends in the diversified range of cryptocurrency wallets. The wallet solely helps users who only operate on the Ethereum blockchain. Being a new player in the market, the wallet has quickly gained popularity among crypto enthusiasts. But what makes it stand out from the rest?

In this Argent wallet review, we explore the features, benefits, and drawbacks of the wallet, which may help you decide if it is the right choice.

What is Argent Wallet?

Argent Wallet is a leading Ethereum-based cryptocurrency wallet that launched in 2020. During the time, the wallet was only meant to be a layer one wallet. However, From that time, the demand for Ethereum has grown, and gas fees on the protocol skyrocketed. The team behind the wallet developed a faster, more scalable version, Argent Wallet Layer 2.

The updated version is not a substitute for the Layer 1 counterpart but includes a broader range of benefits. The Layer 1 option remains the wallet’s main settlement layer.

The wallet is available as a mobile app for iOS and Android. It allows you to store, send, earn interest, and invest within the wallet. It also brings in a unique functionality that assists in making decentralized apps (dApps).

The Argent Wallet is decentralized, and only you can access your assets, and nobody has the power to stop you from accessing them.

Pros

Gives multiple layers of security compared to other crypto wallets.

It supports tricky wallets and enables easy recovery.

The wallet gives returns as interest on the assets lent by users through DeFi.

Has a low gas fee.

Cons

Smart contract clashes when liquid staking ETH.

Centralized infrastructure even though it is a decentralized hot wallet.

The indirect process of storing WBT can be challenging for new users.

How Does Argent Work?

To use Argent Wallet, you must download the mobile app on your iOS or Android smartphone. As the wallet is built on the Ethereum blockchain, your assets are stored, and you control them through the Argent app.

You have complete control over your wallet as you hold the private keys. Argent cannot access your assets or stop you from accessing them. You can also use the funds for other actions like transactions with external dApps.

Argent Wallet Key Features

Argent has some outstanding features. Such custom traits are mainly designed to ensure that you get maximum wallet benefits.

ETH Staking

Argent offers a lucrative Ethereum staking on the Ethereum chain after the merge and cross-chain on leading Layer 1 blockchains like Solana, Polkadot, Terra, and Polygon.

Argent has also integrated Lido Finance as one of its DeFi applications to achieve the requisite staking capabilities. Lido is a central liquid staking platform popular among enthusiasts. Stakers can commit their assets to the platform for profit, and then Lido generates derivative tokens.

Security

Like all crypto wallets, protecting your assets should be your number one concern. Argent operates as one of the most secure wallets. As a non-custodial DeFi wallet, only you can access and control your crypto assets, not even Argent. The platform implements some of the best security features targeted at transfer protection.

Argent implements multi-sig protection, where you can select guardian accounts. There is also a seed-phrase-free wallet recovery. In this way, when you lose the credential to your wallet, you can quickly regain access without seed phrases. The wallet also implements wallet locking, where a guardian can prevent your wallet from making transactions.

Profits from Liquidity Generation

Argent allows for the presence of good liquidity pools. For instance, the USDC/DAI liquidity pool generates about 2.5% of revenue for its liquidity providers. However, it is crucial to note that Argent is more lucrative using the Balancer integration.

Argent Wallet Fees

At its launch, Argent intended to provide fee-free transactions. However, the increase in gas fees made it no longer feasible for them to do so. Argent only charges a 0.5% commission per transaction. The commission is paid in ETH.

Besides that, you may incur the network’s gas fee, which entirely goes to the Ethereum blockchain, facilitating transactions. Gas fees fluctuate based on network congestion. Argent is, however, affordable as it has reduced congestion due to its high transaction processing speeds.

Supported Cryptocurrencies and DApps

The Argent wallet is built on the Ethereum blockchain and is focused on Ethereum. You can access over 240 different Ethereum-based (ERC20) tokens in Argent. Such tokens include ETH, DAI, MKR, LINK, USDT, UNI, and WBTC.

Additionally, the wallet paves the way to access the most popular DeFi dApps from within your wallet. You can easily earn interest by providing liquidity for loans and exchanges with Compound, DAI savings, AAVE, and PoolTogether.

How to Install Argent Wallet Extension on Your Computer

1: Head over to the Chrome browser Argent Wallet extension and click the Add to Chrome button.

Step 2: Click Add Extension on the pop-up button, which allows Chrome to download the extension.

Step 3: Once the downloads s complete, you will be redirected to an Argent X tab with the options to either Create a new wallet or Restore an existing one. Create the new wallet option.

Step 4: Read the disclaimer, check the boxes next to them, and click Continue to proceed.

Step 5: Enter your password, reconfirm it, and click Create Wallet. Finish the process.

Final Thoughts

Argent is a wallet with high potential and comprises a unique combination of functionalities that can be utilized by a vast range of users from varying blockchains. For any user who only deals with the Ethereum blockchain, Argent would be an easy recommendation for those who are okay with maintaining a separate wallet for their Ethereum-based assets.

The only drawback of its functionalities is that it only supports tokens built on the Ethereum blockchain. There is also no desktop app for Argent, only an extension.

FAQs

Is Argent Wallet free?

You do not need to pay a dime to use the Argent wallet.

Is Argent Wallet safe?

Argent Wallet operates as one of the safest software crypto wallets on the market. The wallet is self-custodial and implements more security features like multi-sig, seed-phrase-free wallet recovery, and wallet locking. Such measures prevent unauthorized asset transfers.
